metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20299 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR's Multipart input file functionality. A crafted multi-part input file with no actual parts can trigger a NULL pointer dereference. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-20299` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr25 - 2.5.4-2
openexr - 2.5.4-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.4-2').
